contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Operation Chopper |partof=The [[Vietnam War]] |date=January 12, 1962 |place=[[South Vietnam]] |result=Several US/South Vietnamese victories.<ref name="BattlefieldVietnam">[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FKjYalIpb3Y&feature=channel_page Battlefield Viet Nam Episode 5 "The Undeclared War"] PBS.</ref> |combatant1= {{flag|United States}} {{flag|South Vietnam}} |combatant2={{flagicon|South Vietnam|PRG}} [[National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam|National Liberation Front]] |commander1={{flagicon|South Vietnam}} [[Nguyen Xuan Vinh]] <br> {{flagicon|USA}} [[Robert MacNamara]] |commander2=None |strength1=American Helicopters transported over 1000 |strength2=50 |casualties1=None |casualties2=6 Killed }} {{Campaignbox Vietnam War}} '''Operation Chopper''' occurred on January 12, 1962 and was the first time US forces participated in major combat in the [[Vietnam War]]. In December 1961, the USNS docked in [[Saigon]] with 82 [[US Army]] [[Piasecki H-21]] helicopters. A little more than 12 days later, Operation Chopper commenced.<ref name="chop">Lieutenant General John J. Tolson, CMH Pub 90-4 AIRMOBILITY 1961-1971 (WASHINGTON, D. C.: Department of the Army, Center of Military History, 1989).</ref> The helicopters transported over 1,000<ref>http://www.vietnam-war.info/battles/operation_chopper.php</ref> [[South Vietnam]]ese [[paratrooper]]s for an assault on a suspected [[Viet Cong|NLF]] stronghold 10 miles west of Saigon. The NLF were surprised and soundly defeated, but they gained valuable combat experience they would later use with great effect against US troops. The paratroopers also captured a sought-after underground [[radio transmitter]].<ref name="chop"/> This operation heralded a new era of [[air mobility]] for the U.S. Army, which had been slowly growing as a concept since the Army formed twelve helicopter [[battalion]]s in 1952 as a result of the [[Korean War]]. These new battalions eventually formed a sort of modern day [[cavalry]] for the Army.<ref name="chop"/> ==References== <references/> {{coord missing|Vietnam}} [[Category:Battles and operations of the Vietnam War|Chopper]] [[Category:1962 in Vietnam]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1962]] [[Category:Military operations involving Vietnam]]
